channel.title: How to disable viewmodel bloodstains?
channel.description: Both on weapons and hands. Is there a console command for that?

item.title: How to disable viewmodel bloodstains?
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Well, it appears that until the developers implement the option to remove individual splatters from the viewmodels, the cl_mdldetailfx_enable 0 option is your best bet.

Hopefully that has helped you. I will close this thread as the question appears to have been answered.

Please use the Got a Question? - Enquiries About the Mod thread for questions like this in the future. Thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable viewmodel bloodstains?
item.dc:creator: Xeoxer
item.description:
Crypt19:

I guess it’s not something that’s added yet.

There is a command for that: cl_mdldetailfx_enable 0
But it will also disable aliens being covered in blood as they die.

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable viewmodel bloodstains?
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
I guess it’s not something that’s added yet.

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable viewmodel bloodstains?
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
He wipes his gloves when he reaches for another weapon?

Limitation on the engine, I think. Oh well, has there been confirmation that a console command or convar can remove the splatters on the viewmodels? Or is this something inherent in the mod’s programming? If it’s the former and the command has been provided, I will close this thread. If it’s the latter, the developers know about it and will work on it to provide it as an option, and I will close this thread.

So, has a solution been reached?

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable viewmodel bloodstains?
item.dc:creator: RK1
item.description:
Hawk-kun:

it’s also rather strange how Gordon’s gloves clean themselves when you switch weapons (say your crowbar is covered in gunk) then switching to the pistol, tada, magical clean gloves

switch back to crowbar

regooped

Because the hands are part of the viewmodel. The goop disappears because the other weapons are not gooped, and thus their viewmodels are not either.

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable viewmodel bloodstains?
item.dc:creator: Keresh
item.description:
You know, there’s actually a thread for asking questions. Use it instead of making new threads.

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable viewmodel bloodstains?
item.dc:creator: BendyBread
item.description:
Xeoxer:

What do you mean? Aliens’ blood is yellow, not green.

Well, my point was that gooey murky yellow (It’s green when it splats when you hit things, but ‘paints’ yellow).
Either way, my opinion remains about the current iteration slightly annoying/grossing me, not to be annoyingly pedantic about the exact colour and shade I mean to explain.

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable viewmodel bloodstains?
item.dc:creator: Xeoxer
item.description:
BendyBread:

I’m fine with the aliens and the killing, etc etc.

I just had the grimey green blood, that’s all. Regular blood, bullsquid acid/spit is fine, but eh. I don’t like that green muck all over the gloves and weapons as a personal preference, not that I have a problem with violence.

What do you mean? Aliens’ blood is yellow, not green.

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable viewmodel bloodstains?
item.dc:creator: BendyBread
item.description:
your-name-here:

You’re playing a game that is inherently built around killing alien creatures so I hope you’ll understand that something like that isn’t a priority

Maybe I could tie in the low violence setting to this though, we will see. I have a lot of other stuff to tackle first.

I’m fine with the aliens and the killing, etc etc.

I just had the grimey green blood, that’s all. Regular blood, bullsquid acid/spit is fine, but eh. I don’t like that green muck all over the gloves and weapons as a personal preference, not that I have a problem with violence.

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable viewmodel bloodstains?
item.dc:creator: Chickenprotector
item.description:
your-name-here:

I don’t believe you can in the currently released build. I will make this an option for our next release.

There’s a convar you can use. I forget what it is, but it SHOULD be an option. I know there is one because I disabled it myself…

Hawk-kun:

What determines how the blood covers the weapon?

The animator/modeler of the original file.

Edit: Found it! cl_mdldetailfx_enable 0

Restart your game after so it saves the settings.

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable viewmodel bloodstains?
item.dc:creator: your-name-here
item.description:
BendyBread:

Just as confirmation, will their also be an option to separately turn on/off the alien blood?
Not because it looks bad. It just for some reason makes me a bit grossed out in a way I don’t want to be.

You’re playing a game that is inherently built around killing alien creatures so I hope you’ll understand that something like that isn’t a priority

Maybe I could tie in the low violence setting to this though, we will see. I have a lot of other stuff to tackle first.

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable viewmodel bloodstains?
item.dc:creator: Xeoxer
item.description:
Cutting on texture seams is why I want to disable it because I use Luffy’s improved viewmodels pack. The seam issue is very ugly with Glock and Magnum in that pack. Actually, I can’t believe that’s not a selectable option in game options, while many more trivial options are there.

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable viewmodel bloodstains?
item.dc:creator: sgtpieman
item.description:
It also has some issues with texture mapping. It kind of cuts off at parts of the texture seam. The effect is a great idea, but the execution was kind of a letdown.

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable viewmodel bloodstains?
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
the bullsquid spit is my favorite effect but the on-gun blood’s texture file location has plagued me since release. I want to replace them with some dark crisp, non-pixelly decals but I don’t exactly know if it’s so easy. For all I know it just slaps on blood decals used elsewhere in the game
